msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist; names of the donors; incipit of all sections and subsections; a few other words like ḥawarya "apostle"; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals. On the incipit page of Texts I-1 and I-2 (fols. 3r, 45r) several groups of lines are rubricated.

msItem.note: - Text I-1 includes accounts on the creation of the angels, the war between the angels and Satan, the kidan between God and Archangel Michael. The regular introduction to the homily is presented on fols. 10va-13rb.
- Text I-13 includes a miracle (fols. 80rb-82ra) for Dorotheus and Theopista which is very similar to the homily for Taḫśaś.

Amen. It was written in the year of mercy 1960 after the Italians were expelled during the reign of our King Ḫaylä Śǝllase, appointee of God, liberator of Ethiopia from servitude and the light of the lamp from darkness. Rest for the cultivators of the earch. Doom for the violent ones, robbers and oppressors. Because to him was given the wisdom of Solomon and David through a lot of prayer and patience. Because his time is the time of comfort and rest, which will not be gained again until the Second Birth. Let us plead for him that God may give him long years without war, in joy and gladness, with his sinful and erring scribe ʾabba Baḥrǝyä Śǝllase. Forever and ever. Amen. Rhymed colophon mentions the date 1960 year of mercy (= 1967/68 A.D.).

Fol. 86ra: Donation note.Fol. 86ra: ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘመልአከ፡ ሰላም፡ ዘማርያም፡ ወዘእማሆይ፡ ዓመተ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ዘወሀብዋ፡ ለቅድስት፡ ማርያም፡ ደብረ፡ መዓር፡ ዘሠረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ በሥልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ውጉዝ፡ ለይኩን፡ አሜን።...
The note, written in the main hand, states that the Ms. was donated to Qǝddǝst Maryam Däbrä Mäʿar by mälʾakä sälam Zä-Maryam and by ʾǝmmahoy ʿAmätä ʾIyäsus. The note mentions the name of the scribe, Baḥrǝyä Śǝllase.

- The name Saṭnaʾel is written back to front and upside down: fols. 4vb, 5ra. - Tämälläs-signs indicating the place where the omissions, written in the margin, belong: fols. 5ra, 45rb, 55vb. - Omitted letters or words are written interlineally, sometimes in red: e.g., fols. 12vb, 22vb, 23ra, 29rb, 34vb, 35rb, 38ra, 43vb, 46ra, 48vb, 74ra, 84ra. - Immediate correction: word to be cancelled is indicated by thin lines above and below: fol. 78vb. - Scribbles: fol. 88v.

origin.origDate: According to the colophon, the Ms. was written in 1960 year of mercy (= 1967/68 A.D.) during the time of King Ḫaylä Śǝllase I (r. 1930-74).
